text: The Requena Province is one of the eight provinces in the Loreto Region of Peru. It was created by Law No. 9815 on July 2, 1943 by president Manuel Prado Ugarteche. Municipalidad Provincial de Requena, Reseña. Retrieved on November 5, 2007. Its territory is part of the Amazon Rainforest, as such, it is characterized by high temperatures, heavy rainfall and a wide diversity of plants and animals. Municipalidad Provincial de Requena, Requena: el boom del turismo ecológico. Retrieved on November 5, 2007. ==Political division== The province is divided into eleven districts. * Alto Tapiche (Santa Elena) * Capelo (Flor de Punga) * Emilio San Martín (Tamanco) * Jenaro Herrera (Jenaro Herrera) * Maquia (Santa Isabel) * Puinahua (Bretaña) * Requena (Requena) * Saquena (Bagazan) * Soplin (Nueva Alejandría) * Tapiche (Iberia) * Yaquerana (Angamos) ==Notes== Category:Provinces of the Loreto Region
title: Requena Province
